title: LEGCO QUESTION NO.17 (Written Reply)
question_text: Asked by: Hon LAU Kong-wah Date of meeting : 3 March 1999 Replied by : Secretary for Health and Welfare Question: (a) of the number of cases reported since the authorities set up a hotline last August for the public to report suspected abuse cases; the follow-up actions taken against these reported cases; and the number of cases among them proved to be abusing the CSSA Scheme; and (b) whether the authorities will consider resuming the conducting of visits to the dwelling of each CSSA

authorities will consider resuming the conducting of visits to the dwelling of each CSSA
applicant when dealing with the application?
reply_text:
Madam President, (a) Social Welfare
Department (SWD) set up a telephone hotline in last August for the public to report on
suspected fraud cases. Up to the end of January 1999, a total of 3 059 cases were
reported, of which 816 cases contained sufficient information for follow up actions by
SWD. Upon receipt of these reports, SWD referred them to the respective Social Security
Field Units for investigation. After in-depth investigation, SWD found that there was no
evidence of fraud in 300 cases. 18 cases were established as fraud cases and they were

referred to the police for prosecution. Another 24 cases involved over-payments due to
misunderstanding on the part of the applicants and SWD will seek refund from the
recipients or deduct the overpaid amount from their future payments. The remaining 474
cases are still under investigation.
